title: First Strike Project Yasuo card?

embed.description: We're releasing two new ways to interact with and enhance your PROJECT experience in this PBE update. PROJECT First Strike Be among the first to unlock new PROJECT skins from 9/8 - 9/15 23:59 PDT and show that you were part of the First Strike with permanent exclusive loading screen cards.

body:
Pretty simple request.  It would be awesome if there was one of those custom First Strike loading cards for Project: Yasuo in addition to the other skins.  (maybe given to everyone who has or buys skin by end of First Strike week?)

He was the actual first strike for the Project series and all!

See link for relevant information from Nurse Flan!

replies.body:
Hey MrRado,

We don't have plans to give PROJECT: Yasuo a First Strike border. As Vi King Vi mentioned, it would be unfair to those who already purchased the skin.
Why not give the first strike loading screen to all the people who bought yasuo when he was first released, AND during the first strike week?

This would be unfair to players purchasing First Strike skins for 1350 RP at launch. 

When Yasuo was first released, he was on sale for 975 RP, and a lot of players take advantage of the sale price. It'd be unfair that Yasuo players get a loading screen for 975 RP, when loading screens for the new PROJECT skins can only be obtained by paying full price.

that's an easy fix, actually. Give every player that bought PROJECT: Yasuo during the first week the option to "purchase" the first strike loading card for the difference. This way, if they want it, they'll pay the full price just like everyone else, and if they don't then that's their choice.

(might want to make sure they get an in-game prompt the first time they log in just to make sure they don't miss it)

I actually agree with Riot's position here, but I can also appreciate the other side


my idea was that, a kind of store option like Chroma packs could be available during First Strike week

playing 375 RP for the playercard symbol on the Yasuo skin
--it wouldnt be necessarily fair for people who paid the full price for it, but as mentioned above the cost would be for collector's value


there's also a precedent, where you added borders to the skins of players who had Limited skins before they were locked away in the Vault even thought it had been a very long time

just my two cents

I fully agree with you, I'd be unfair if people who bought PROJECT: Yasuo for 975 get a border but a addon to it, if you will, will be nice. Like a 375 RP border in the shop for like a week together with the other project skins will be nice. I think thats a good idea, it will be limited like the other project skin borders and will be satisfying for players like me who want that border on yasuo.

You bring up valid points, and a lot of other people do as well, with possible alternatives.

So I just wanted to give another explanation, maybe a little bit of a longer one, on a different way to look at this.

See, when people first bought Yasuo's skin, they didn't have a plan for a border - it wasn't, "Oo I want this for a border", it was, "This is a really nice skin.  I think I'd like playing with that."  So a lot of people did and it was fine and cool and fun.  Project Yasuo wasn't even on sale for a full week either if I'm recalling correctly - more like 3 or 4 days.  Not a ton of time.

But let's also dial this all back even longer - to the original "card borders", when the owners of legacy skins who got them when they first came out would get exclusive borders.

http://i.imgur.com/pDTn7uY.jpg

See Sona's border? That wasn't announced on release, that wasn't a plan, that was an afterthought.  A "Hey, you've had this skin since before we retired it, we don't mind showing your early patronage" deal.  And that was pretty dang cool.  Nobody afterward felt slighted because they weren't the originals - they didn't get the skin right when it came out, and that was on them. It was just a cool thing.  And I'll be that before those skins were retired, they went on sale once or twice in their lifetime - anybody coulda gotten them then at a reduced price and _still_ gotten the border.

So jump to now with the project skins - Yasuo came out first, cool skin, wanted it, got it.  Whether it was full or reduced price isn't too important, honestly - it's early patronage. It's an early, "Before this became a thing I was in it for the shiggles."  While you're giving chance for bot new and old players to grab some exclusive content - woooooooooo - the fact is you're shafting the old players with this choice.  You've given nothing back to the old owners who grabbed the skin before there was ever an event.

Like, look at Project Yasuo's splash art - compared to these new skins, it looks dated already.  In fact, look in game at their animations - his **in-game** even looks lesser comparatively.  And don't even get me started on the graphical issues that he still has (hello sheathe facing the wrong way, hello sword sticking out of sheathe at an awkward angle, hello sword being **gone** sometimes on a Q).  And now there's not even anything to go along with his skin to pretty it up a bit?  The fact is: the skin just looks like it's worth far less now with those new skins to compare it to.  But no, it's the same price.  It's stayed the same price.  People have payed 1350 for it, and some are probably going, "Well, while it looks nice, I do also play those other champs and they look way, way, way better." And now you've added additional "collector's" value to these new ones - you're just piling on how shafted people were getting the original Project skin.  And it's not unfair to new buyers just because some people only payed 975 for the skin and got a border - they did it way, way, way back.  They were smart or lucky - choose one.  Neither of those are a punishment to those who'd have to pay full price for the skin - it's a reward to older players for having made the decision.  The borders before weren't a punishment to new players for never getting the skin before they were retired - it was a reward for owning them back then.  It was a reward saying, "Hey, we've been releasing some better skins lately, but you stuck with us during the period where they were a little less lustrous - here's a little thank you for that."  And what's wrong with that?

You don't have to give Project Yasuo a First Strike border, but you really absolutely should give us _some_thing for having owned him since before this - otherwise not only is the skin just uglier, but it's considerably less worth the cost.

I'm sorry, what? Despite what many players seem to think, Cool Shiny Things are not a rare resource. No one is being deprived of anything by owners of the original skin getting a cool "hey, let's not let this skin be obsolete from the rest of its line" shiny.

Couldn't you add an option to purchase First Strike Bundle Yasuo that costs 1350 (375 if you already have the Project Yasuo Skin) that includes the border? That would allow individuals to get Project Yasuo, and for people who already bought the skin to have a chance of getting a First Strike Border.
This. How difficult can this be?

This idea kind of defeats the point of First Strike, which is buying the skin at full price in exchange for a bit of collector's value, since the people that bought PROJECT: Yasuo upon release did so at discount price.
You don't think that paying around 5$ for a border is excessive?

I don't, really.

I mean, I know I will not be buying the PROJECT skins during First Strike, as the border is not valuable enough to me.

However, I think the 'excessive' label is fundamentally subjective in this matter. For people unwilling to spend real money in this game, any amount of RP is 'excessive'.

Also, the increased price tag brings more than that border alone, it gives you abstract collector's value, preferred access to the skins in game and additional time to enjoy the PROJECT features that will be active during 5.17 and 5.18.

> Also, the increased price tag brings more than that border alone, it gives you abstract collector's value, preferred access to the skins in game and additional time to enjoy the PROJECT features that will be active during 5.17 and 5.18.

Pretty much this.

We realize that newer players may not have had as many opportunities to collect skins/content (i.e. Judgment Kayle), We felt this was a good opportunity for both new and old players to engage with limited edition content.

In addition, we felt that it'd be a bad feeling that there wasn't the normal 975 RP sale on all 1350 RP skins, which is why we wanted to include it, just a week later. We thought of it similarly to champions - on release their IP price is a bit higher, and then it's lowered.

However, couldn't Riot have done the following:
1) Find out all the players that purchased Project: Yasuo during the first week of his release.
2) Offered them the ability to purchase an "upgrade" for the difference in RP (the bonus content - border, additional time to project features, etc.).

The data is there (at least the people that bought it at that time).  It's a matter of "Do we want to do an upgrade-type package for Yasuo" or not.  Would be a matter of: is it worth the money to make it verse what you get in return - which only Riot can answer.  Maybe Riot already thought of this and thought it wasn't worth it?

Thank you KateyKhaos!

I do understand why everyone wants something special for Yasuo, but this isn't the way to go about it.

I'm also gonna say that anyone who says "well what about people who play/buy/etc. with the skin during the first strike timing." That is still really unfair and giving it to everyone who owns/buys the skin, is going to be unfair to the people willing to pay full price for a special boarder for the brand new skins that are being released. I getting two of the skins, on first strike as a birthday present. The boarder is what makes it a really awesome gift. I will feel really upset if everyone just got the boarder for playing/buying an older skin that isn't even the focus.

This is the ONLY way to go about it! Riot offers no other means to leave suggestions and the fact that you haven't even recognized that everyone on this thread has offered the solution of paying the little extra to compensate for the original release price difference is only negatively affecting this process.

Okay, 
Why should everyone else pay less then 5 dollars for something, that everyone else is going to end up paying way more for?
Just you can get a boarder?

Yasuo is on sale right now for one. And you don't get to say "let us pay way less to get something for an older skin that was only created for the new ones".

People are willing to pay full price for the benefit of the boarder. It is a gift. It doesn't cost 375 RP. It is a free gift, bought when spending full price on the skins as early as possible. 

The boarder is nothing but a collectors item, a free gift for those willing to spend the most amount of money the soonest. Not to be used on an older skin, that wasn't place at full price to start. 

Want the boarder, buy the different project skins.
Riot will lose money if they practically gave it away, and it will be unfair to those willing to spend more money to get the collectors item. 

It had nothing to do with Yasuo. It didn't include him. Paying less for something others are paying way more for, is unfair. 

Not including Yasuo, happened. it is not unfair to not include him. 

It's business and it's about being fair to the most amount of people who want the new skins.
**
You are not entitled to future benefits of a skin lines release. Regardless if you are willing to pay the "difference" **

You have a point, but think about it, this discussion wouldn't exist if people were like "Yasuo isnt getting a first strike border so ill buy all the other skins to compensate for that".I will probably get some of the skins or at least one of them, but people want this border on Yasuo precisely, thats what we are all talking about. It feels like Yasuo is being left out from something he should be a part of, And Yasuo players such as me, dont like it. for me its not unfair that Yasuo isnt getting a border, its that i dont like it that hes being left out of the whole PROJECT theme. because if I dont get any of the skins now I wont have the First Strike border, and someday my friends will be like "hey lets make a project themed team" and I just wont like it when we're all loading and they have that flashy border and im just with that PROJECT: Outdated skin that's not as important as the other skins. I wouldnt like that and I, and not just me, want to have something of value on Yasuos' skin just like others will have with the First Strike borders.

Well that did not happen.  He wasn't included in it, it sucks. Oh well. I get that it does suck. I understand where you are coming from. You are still missing my point. 

Riot doesn't owe you or anyone anything simply because they bought an old skin. You are not entitled to anything. At all.

Someone who paid way more money to get the benefit of the boarder, isn't going to be happy that you got to spend less money, on an old skin, to get the same benefit. Especially since he was excluded from the event. 

_You still get the benefit of the starting animation for when you load into a game, you still get the project minions for the next two patches, and anyone wanting to buy the skin now, it's half off the price. _

He isn't going to get a boarder that wasn't designed for him. Riot said no. That's the end of it. 

**_My personal feelings is that it would make sense for him to get a boarder,_ _It makes sense to me for you guys to want this and I agree that for art sake, having all the skins with a boarder would be nice_**. I do feel though, that if you want the boarder, you need to pay the same amount as everyone else for it. Regardless if you bought the skin or not. It's the RP for the boarder and the skin, not Boarder + sale price skin as separate entities.  but spending 1350 for a skin you already own, is ridiculous.
yasuo deserves some luv cmon hes  the person who started the project series

It wouldn't be unfair to those who already purchased it.  The OPs request includes anyone who already has it.  You could even make it to where you have to play a matchmade game with it (like Gangplank).  As far as I'm aware, there was never a First Strike Border released for Yasuo, so no one is jipped out of something cool (as if Black Nasus or King Rammus were rereleased).  It's something that should probably be done to make the Project: skins feel like an actual cycle.
Yasuo's skin was released on the discount starting  out, these skins are not. So unless you are willing to cover the cost with RP to get the boarder. It's not fair.
I was saying it wouldn't be unfair to the ones who bought Yasuo. You're talking about the people buying the new skins. We are taking about different people.

It's not fair to those who are willing to buy the new skins at full price as early as possible, for people who already have bought a skin at discounted price to pay literally less then them, to get the same collectors item. 
This has everything to do with how it will impact the players wanting the new skins. 

If I have an item that's brand new, really good quality, and buy choosing to buy it right as it's released at full price instead of waiting for a sale.  I get a benefit. 

Those boarders have nothing to do with Yasuo, he was not included, he doesn't get anything. Those who own the skin, or will buy the skin, won't get the shiny benefit simply because _it wasn't included. _ Riot choose to not include it. 

The only thing connection Yasuo and the new skins, is they come from the same line. They are the same theme. Doesn't mean they have to always be receiving the same treatment.
I think you're missing the point.  Of course he's not included.  That's the point of this thread.  It's an attempt to include him.

Okay, again. Gonna make this clear. 

Yasuo wasn't apart of this idea. It doesn't matter if he was first. He wasn't included, Riot didn't seem to want to include him or they would have. Just because you want it, doesn't mean Riot is going to give it. It's not "basic stuff". Its a collectors item that is supposed to be unique to these skins specifically. Not Yasuo. They choose not to do it and they aren't going to do it because people want it. 

This boarder, is just a boarder for one, but it's also a limited edition item for those who are willing to buy these **new skins at full price instead of a discount price. Yasuos skin was originally discounted,  **

Riot does not owe anyone anything. They aren't going to just give it to people who happen to buy/already own that skin for Yasuo. 

_It's unfair to everyone wanting these new skins who are willing to pay a lot of money for them, Riot won't make money, and the value of the boarders, which are meant to be rare collectors items, will drastically go down. _

Stop saying that it's perfectly fine for a company, that needs money, to give shit away for free because people want it. Just because it's related to another skin.

All good points.  

I don't think they owe any of this to us.  I just had a simple request that would make me feel better about a portion of the product that is offered to us.

In the same vein though, for a set of collector's items I would like to see it included (for my personal desire to have a sense of completion).  The project skin teaser site includes all six skins, solidifying the connection.

I'd pay for it.  
I'd accept it as a bonus reward for purchasing all five other skins during First Strike.  
Since its not happening, I will likely just purchase a few of the skins during their 2nd week sale (where I would've picked up all 5 on the first week).  Both of those outcomes are ok with me.

I know that may not make sense to some.  

I won't lose any sleep or feel very strongly over it not happening, nor would I EVER suggest a change that would negatively impact any players with new or previous purchases.  Its just a simple suggestion that would make me feel better and I have no hard feelings over it not happening.

There already have been many ideas for compromises for the so called "unfairness" you mention and the fact you and those at Riot didn't even consider these simple ideas leave the community confused and angry. As well Vi King Vi has only led to toxicity in this thread since they haven't read or considered these ideas.

Hey ODedonlife,

Before we release content, there is a lot of discussion behind the scenes as to what we'd like to do, and how we'd like to do it. 

This particular thread was made after we'd made a call on what we were doing for this promotion, so unfortunately, we weren't able to change/make compromises because the content was already packaged to be shipped. 

I'd disagree that Vi King Vi has lead to toxicity in this thread. He stated his stance on this, and other disagreed, which lead to some solid discussion around what we could improve the next time we do a promotion similar to this one. 

We always appreciate feedback. We know we're not perfect, and that there are areas where we can improve. Threads like these are great to help us understand pain points for you, and what you'd like to see in the future.

If the fact that this is a set in stone thing for now because it's been released is understandable but making blanket statements that you are not going to make any changes to not leave out people who in all rights should be given the chance to get the same product since they are of the same family of skins is just absolutely ridiculous. You should at least try and reassure your community that you are going to consider these ideas for THIS issue and not just for future issues of the same context. This is extremely bad business sense and you're only going to make your community consistently more angry.

As for Vi King Vi the reason I stated he has only led to toxicity is the fact that he should be reading the comments and considering the viewpoints of the other people in this thread. He has only made one very single-minded case throughout all his comments and thus does not contribute to furthering of the idea MrRado has put forward.

>  making blanket statements that you are not going to make any changes to not leave out people who in all rights should be given the chance to get the same product since they are of the same family of skins is just absolutely ridiculous. You should at least try and reassure your community that you are going to consider these ideas for THIS issue and not just for future issues of the same context. 

I'm sorry if it's coming off as a blanket statement - that's not my intent at all. I'm a messenger in this case, and providing the information that I have on the subject. 

At this time, we do not have plans to give PROJECT: Yasuo a border, for the initial reason that was given: 

*When Yasuo was first released, he was on sale for 975 RP, and a lot of players take advantage of the sale price. It'd be unfair that Yasuo players get a loading screen for 975 RP, when loading screens for the new PROJECT skins can only be obtained by paying full price.*

We realize that it's not something that everyone agrees with, and that is certainly one of the takeaways from this. 

> As for Vi King Vi the reason I stated he has only led to toxicity is the fact that he should be reading the comments and considering the viewpoints of the other people in this thread. 

I think some people are firmly grounded in some areas, and that's fine. I don't think his comments were malicious, or attacked anyone. Regardless of his stance, there was a lot of good conversation around PROJECT: Yasuo not having a loading screen border. 

As always, thanks for taking the time to leave feedback on the boards and discuss these kinds of topics/issues with us. :]

Thank you for the feedback and just as a final note I would like to bring up Aamano's & LooksLikeYoda suggestion since I found it a very plausible solution to the entire issue of the initial sales price.

I would agree with this, but it is unfair to everyone who bought PROJECT: Yasuo when he first came out. He is the first project skin and the people who bought him when he first came out, would get nothing.

If it was possible, I would suggest giving a special boarder for those who bought PROJECT: Yasuo within the first week of his release. Not for those who are just now buying the skin. It's a limited edition deal for a reason .

They did this because there is a ton of them and they are all really expensive, so they have created an incentive for people to want to buy them full price instead of wait for them to be on sale or not buy them at all. 
Hence why Project minions are something you can get, and the special loading in animation. 

Most people aren't going to be interested in buying them unless they come in a bundle that's just a bit cheaper then full price. As the comments below wrote in the link you posted.

People willing or able to buy them full price, right at release, deserve something extra and limited. This wasn't an option for people who bought PROJECT: Yasuo to start and I don't feel like they should just make an exception for new players buying an older skin.

EDIT: I just made a comment, including the point that Yasuo's skin was released at the discount price. So it really isn't fair to just give those who got the skin for cheaper, a boarder that is meant to be a prize for buying the skins at full price.
Good logic, but I'm not looking to alienate anyone who already owns the skin.  I'd include anyone who bought the skin from its release up until the end of the First Strike week.

Then that completely ignores that whole point of the special limited edition boarders, for the people willing to pay full price a week before anyone else is willing too. That's an insane amount of people to give a boarder too just for buying a skin that's been out for a really long time. 

I do agree Yas is in need of some love, along with the people who bought the skin. I do not think it should be in a way that completely removes the entire point of people willing to pay full price on something they can wait for. 

Especially since the boarder is just a boarder and it's not that fancy.

That's all fair.  It feels a little disjointed to me having 6 related skins but 5 of them have something "more" or "special" added.  The borders are just cosmetic loading items and I won't lose any sleep over this, but I still feel it would be awesome to do.  

I appreciate the input either way.
